events.originalText: An American Lockheed EP-3 and a Chinese Shenyang J-8 collided in mid-air off the island of Hainan, resulting in an international dispute between the two countries.
events.subtitle: Lockheed EP-3
events.headline: American Lockheed EP-3 and Chinese Shenyang J-8 Collide Off Hainan Island

events.originalText: Same-sex marriage in the Netherlands was legalised (wedding pictured), with the country becoming the first to do so.
events.subtitle: Same-sex marriage in the Netherlands
events.headline: Netherlands Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage, First Country to Do So

events.originalText: The longest prison riot in British penal history began at Strangeways Prison in Manchester, lasting for 25 days.
events.subtitle: Strangeways Prison riot
events.headline: Longest Prison Riot in British History Begins at Strangeways Prison

events.originalText: The American Motors Corporation introduced its Gremlin, marketed as America's first subcompact car.
events.subtitle: American Motors Corporation
events.headline: American Motors Corporation Introduces Gremlin Subcompact Car

events.originalText: U.S. president Richard Nixon signed the Public Health Cigarette Smoking Act into law, requiring that a prominent warning by the surgeon general be placed on cigarette packages.
events.subtitle: Richard Nixon
events.headline: President Nixon Signs Public Health Cigarette Smoking Act into Law

events.originalText: The Hawker Siddeley Harrier, the first operational fighter aircraft with V/STOL capabilities, entered service with the Royal Air Force.
events.subtitle: Hawker Siddeley Harrier
events.headline: Hawker Siddeley Harrier Enters Service with Royal Air Force

events.originalText: A law of citizenship is enacted in Israel; prior to this, the country technically had no citizens.
events.subtitle: Israeli citizenship law
events.headline: Israel Enacts Law of Citizenship, Establishing First Citizens

events.originalText: Soviet border guards opened fire on civilians attempting to cross the border from the Soviet Union to Romania near Fântâna Albă, killing between 44 and 3,000 people.
events.subtitle: Fântâna Albă massacre
events.headline: Soviet Border Guards Open Fire on Civilians Near Fântâna Albă

events.originalText: English cricketer Wally Hammond set a record for the highest individual score in Test cricket of 336 not out during a match against New Zealand.
events.subtitle: Cricket
events.headline: Wally Hammond Sets Test Cricket Record with 336 Not Out

events.originalText: Under the South Seas Mandate, Japan set up a government in Koror, precipitating large-scale Japanese settlement in Palau.
events.subtitle: South Seas Mandate
events.headline: Japan Sets Up Government in Koror Under South Seas Mandate

events.originalText: The United Kingdom's Royal Air Force was founded, towards the end of the First World War.
events.subtitle: Royal Air Force
events.headline: Royal Air Force Founded in United Kingdom

events.originalText: The first ever all-Ireland hurling final was played in Birr, County Offaly.
events.subtitle: All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship
events.headline: First All-Ireland Hurling Final Played in Birr, County Offaly

events.originalText: The Inland Customs Line, established by the British for the collection of the salt tax in India, was abandoned.
events.subtitle: Inland Customs Line
events.headline: Inland Customs Line in India Abandoned by British

events.originalText: The Duke of Buckingham opened the first section of the Brill Tramway, a short railway line to transport goods between his lands and the national rail network.
events.subtitle: Richard Temple-Nugent-Brydges-Chandos-Grenville, 3rd Duke of Buckingham and Chandos
events.headline: Duke of Buckingham Opens Brill Tramway Railway Line

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Union Army under Major General Philip Sheridan (pictured) inflicted more than 2,900 casualties on the Confederates at the Battle of Five Forks.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Army Inflicts 2,900 Casualties on Confederates at Battle of Five Forks

events.originalText: Mexican Texans met at San Felipe de Austin to begin the Convention of 1833.
events.subtitle: Mexican Texas
events.headline: Mexican Texans Begin Convention of 1833 at San Felipe de Austin

events.originalText: A band of warriors led by Niels Ebbesen killed Count Gerhard III, ending Holstein rule in Denmark.
events.subtitle: Niels Ebbesen
events.headline: Niels Ebbesen's Warriors Kill Count Gerhard III, Ending Holstein Rule

events.originalText: Robert Winchelsey left England for Rome to be consecrated Archbishop of Canterbury, but a papal vacancy delayed the ceremony.
events.subtitle: Robert Winchelsey
events.headline: Robert Winchelsey Travels to Rome to be Consecrated Archbishop of Canterbury

events.originalText: Richard Marshal, Earl of Pembroke, was defeated by knights loyal to King Henry III of England at the Battle of the Curragh in County Kildare, Ireland.
events.subtitle: Richard Marshal, 3rd Earl of Pembroke
events.headline: Richard Marshal Defeated by King Henry III's Knights at Battle of the Curragh
